revised_title: High-Pressure and High-Temperature Research: Structure and Bonding in the Earth's Deep Interior
tldr: This article discusses recent high-pressure experimental and theoretical studies that provide evidence for fundamental changes in bonding properties of materials under deep Earth conditions. The authors examine structure and bonding in deep mantle and core materials using experimental and theoretical results, focusing on examples such as oxides, silica, perovskites, and metals. The findings highlight the growing understanding of the Earth's deep interior and the importance of iron in mantle phases.
